review: Update 9/16/14!Update!I returned it today , the voice search only works for Amazon content , the FireOS is too locked down and I can't use my apps from Google play store , getting it to work with local content like DVD's i own and backed up to HD is too much of a pain. If they had released it with Android 4.4 unlocked i would have kept it.!Update!I have owned many of the streaming boxes and all have their faults and weakness . I give the Amazon Fire TV 3 stars for now , it would be 5 stars if they would allow apps that work on other android devices like ES file explorer and offer DNLA support and local media streaming options, its just too locked down for me . PLEX isn't that great for this IMHO . I wasn't able to use the USB port to play movies of a USB stick either right out of the box.I had to modify some settings and I was able to side load ES file explorer app though after a little googling and I was able to see my synology NAS using the es file explorer app LAN option once installed on the fire TV so I could play my local media as well as all the media Amazon offers online that works out of the box. XBMC app also worked once side loaded to stream my local content .

review: Faster than my Apple TV and Roku 3, but missing what I see as key features and apps.  Voice feature is fast and accurate, but only searches amazon content.  Roku's search feature did not have voice function, but searches across nearly every major app on the device.No PBS app, which is something even Apple offers.  Of course, you have the option to pay per episode on Amazon's store.If content is your primary consideration, go with Roku.
